review: I own three of these. They are not entirely open as far as running your own apps, but there is a lot of flexibility as far as what you can do with apps from developers other than Google, Netflix, and HBO. One of my favorite apps is Allcast which let's you stream videos and photos stored on your mobile device directly to your Chromecast. The screen mirroring feature is neat but I rarely use it in practice. My favorite reason to own these, or really any streaming stick, are the power savings. The amount of energy Chromecasts consume (at most 5 watts) is a pittance compared to the 200+ watts most computers and consoles use when powered on. In that sense they pay for their selves. The promotions have also netted me 9 months of free Play Music radio and $18 to spend on movies in the play store. If you run them directly from the USB port on your television you can save even more electricity by completely powering off the device with your TV. They're great for slapping onto older "dumb" TVs.
